It sounds like you need to configure your sound driver. Is it an intel-hda chip?
Which computer do you have?
Yeah, I was just checking up on something
gksu gedit /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base
Add the following: snd_hda_intel model=hp-dv5
Save the file, and reboot it. I had the same issue with my current laptop, but that required a different setting - it might not work, as there are so. many. different. settings.
Report back to me to let me know if it worked afterwards :)
You might need to try model=hp instead.
